bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, July 30, 1925

div1.p: Russell sends a copy of a letter describing a suspected death from yellow fever in Parnahyba, Brazil, and asks her to determine if it merits Henry Rose Carter's attention.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, July 30, 1925
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
-----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC HEALTH
LABORATORY SERVICE
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
YELLOW FEVER COUNCIL
HENRY R. CARTER, M.D. HIDEYO NOGUCHI, M.D. JOSEPH H. WHITE, M.D.
MEMBERS
-----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
JOHN G. FITZGERALD
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
NORMA S. THOMPSON
SECRETARY
July 30, 1925
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I am enclosing copy of a note received from Dr.
White with reference to the death from suspected yellow fever
at Parnahyba on May 14, 1925. I realize that Dr. Carter has
been working intensively on the History of Yellow Fever and
naturally has not had time to study the papers on this case
which we sent you under date of July 9. I am sending you
Dr. White's note simply for your information. As usual, we
leave to your discretion the wisdom of bringing the matter to
your father's attention.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F. F. Russell
Miss Laura Carter
2122 California Street, N.W.
Washington
District of Columbia
FFO:HM
